title: Laffy Taffy
description: Country anthems, Broadway sincerity, rap chaos, power ballads, bangerz, and absolute nonsense play in sequence because that is how confidence sounds when it stops explaining itself. Baking happens at the same volume. The oven is on. Taste is suspended. Chad Powers does not wait for proof, and neither does dough. These are the songs from Chad Powers. Not inspired by it. Not adjacent to it. Literally the soundtrack, lifted whole and dropped onto the counter while something bakes. Go Fish.

tracks: Si les anges n'ont pas de sexe
description: Listen to French Rap as you work - Dooz Kawa for 2 1/2 hours.
title: Dooz Kawa Bakes!

Durand Jones & The Indications - Sea Gets Hotter
description: This playlist is not here to motivate you. It assumes you already know what you’re doing. The movements are practiced, the ingredients familiar, the outcome broadly predictable. Nothing needs to be rushed or rescued. Soul, rhythm, and restraint accompany work done at a reasonable pace by someone who has failed before and adjusted accordingly. The oven is hot. The dough will rise. There is no drama in competence, only repetition refined into confidence.
title: Shake It Down

description: This playlist accompanies domestic labor undertaken with disproportionate intensity. The oven is preheated too early. The recipe is followed selectively. Music plays louder than necessary, as if volume alone might impose order. This is not self-care; it is endurance with flour. Repetition is mistaken for control, control for meaning. The counter becomes a work surface, then a stage, then a minor battlefield. If something burns, it was always part of the plan.
title: My oven goes …
